info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 8 at 3:23PM EDT until May 8 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall developing over much of Chatham County, including the Savannah Metro area. A quick 1 to 2 inches of rain could fall through 445 PM, resulting in minor flooding or urban and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hunter Army Airfield, Savannah International Airport, Windsor Forest, Downtown Savannah, Midtown Savannah, Godley Station, Coffee Bluff and Hutchinson Island.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
